text: The unique and supreme voluptuousness of love lies in the certainty of committing evil. And men and women know from birth that in evil is found all sensual delight.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: I have known more men destroyed by the desire to have wife and child and to keep them in comfort than I have seen destroyed by drink and harlots.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: It is not true that suffering ennobles the character happiness does that sometimes, but suffering for the most part, makes men petty and vindictive.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

text: It is a clear truth that those who every day barter away other men's liberty will soon care little for their own.
author: James Otis

text: A strong hatred is the best lamp to bear in our hands as we go over the dark places of life, cutting away the dead things men tell us to revere.
author: Rebecca West
